title: Mombasa
summary: Mombasa (/mɒmˈbæsə/ mom-BASS-ə, also US: /-ˈbɑːs-/ -⁠BAH-sə) is a coastal city in southeastern Kenya along the Indian Ocean. The city is known as the white and blue city in Kenya. It is the country's oldest (circa 900 AD) and second-largest city[3] (after the capital Nairobi), with a population of about 1,208,333 people according to the 2019 census.[1] Its metropolitan region is the second-largest in the country, and has a population of 3,528,940 people.[1]
